sentence.text: Previous reports have identified chemical synaptic transmission variants in patients with generalized epilepsies, such as myoclonic-atonic epilepsy and childhood absence epilepsy.

The purpose of this study was to determine the incidence of chemical synaptic transmission variants in 460 unselected epilepsy patients and to evaluate the impact of the identified variants on Î³-aminobutyric acid (GABA)transport.

These findings demonstrate that chemical synaptic transmission is an important contributor to childhood epilepsy and that reduced GAT-1 function is a common consequence of epilepsy-causing SLC6A1 variants
